Types

Cont = ref object of RootObj
  fn*: proc (c: Cont): Cont {...}{.nimcall.}
  when cpsDebug:
      clock: Clock             ## time of latest poll loop
      delay: Duration          ## polling overhead

Procs

proc len(eq: EventQueue): int {...}{.raises: [], tags: [].}
the number of pending continuations 
proc add(eq: var EventQueue; cont: Cont): Id {...}{.raises: [], tags: [TimeEffect].}
add a continuation to the queue; returns a registration 
proc addTimer(cont: Cont; interval: Duration) {...}{.raises: [ValueError],
    tags: [TimeEffect].}
run a continuation after an interval 
proc addTimer(cont: Cont; ms: int) {...}{.raises: [ValueError], tags: [TimeEffect].}
run a continuation after some milliseconds have passed 
proc addTimer(cont: Cont; seconds: float) {...}{.raises: [ValueError], tags: [TimeEffect].}
run a continuation after some seconds have passed 
proc addYield(cont: Cont) {...}{.raises: [], tags: [TimeEffect].}
proc stop() {...}{.raises: [], tags: [TimeEffect].}
tell the dispatcher to stop 
proc trampoline(c: Cont) {...}{.raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}
trampoline 
proc poll() {...}{.raises: [Exception, KeyError, OSError], tags: [RootEffect, TimeEffect].}
see what needs doing and do it 
proc run(interval: Duration = DurationZero) {...}{.raises: [Exception, KeyError, OSError],
    tags: [TimeEffect, RootEffect].}
the dispatcher runs with a maximal polling interval; an interval of DurationZero causes the dispatcher to return when the queue is empty.
